results.title: Molecules at work (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Shows that most of the energy that is used by man is derived from chemical re-actions. Illustrates how chemical energy is converted to heat and how the heat is converted into work as efficiently as possible. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: The Second law of thermodynamics (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Discusses and illustrates the second law of thermodynamics which states that every system which is left to itself will, on the average, change towards a position of maximum probability. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.

results.title: Screwcutting
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
The film starts with a short general discussion of screw threads, pitch and shape. The principle of the screw-cutting lathe is illuatrated by mounting a wooden cylinder in the lathe and using a lead pencil instead of a cutting tool.

results.title: Turning, facing and boring
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lathework series”.
A flanged bush of phosphor bronze is seen being machined from a rough casting, a job which introduced the operations mentioned in the title of the film. The different tools used are mounted on a four-way tool post, and each in turn is seen in use. Chamfering is also demonstrated.

results.title: An Introduction to the lathe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lathework series”.
Various operations are shown briefly, then a simple type of lathe is examined systematically, headstock, cradle, tailstock, methods of holding the work by chucks, by face plate and between centres. Methods of feed, hand and automatic.

results.title: The Mateship commune
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. The story of the few years that have become known as the “Golden Age” of Australian painting. Impressionism was founded by Tom Roberts, Arthur Streeton, Frederick McCubbin and Charles Conder; The Heidelberg School. Narrated by Robert Hughes. Photography by Tony Wilson.

results.title: Charm school
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
Another in the series following the development of Australian art and artists. Robert Hughes discusses the work of Russell Drysdale, Donald Friend, Jean Bellette, Paul Haeflinger, David Strachan, William Dobell, Justin O’Brien, Sali Herman, Lloyd Rees, and Geoffrey Smart. Written and narrated by Robert Hughes.
